description: experiment id (should link to experiment.id in experiment tracker file) indicating which experiment the data 'belongs to' (which experiment was used to generate the data)

notes: auto-infers the file name as name
auto-infers the path relative to the working directory

description: for tabular data resource, row description
notes: e.g. one row represents one subject at one timepoint

description: for multi-file resource containing multiple files of the same type, file description

notes: references a heal csv dd file; this file will be converted to a heal json dd, then to a frictionless tabular resource schema format and either referenced or placed inline in the resource schema property; if this field is empty then the contents of the schema property are the minimal frictionless-inferred fields
private means members of the public cannot request access; restricted access means they can request access but there is gate-keeping
if other files are necessary to make this file (e.g. raw data file necessary to  make processed data file) list them here; only one layer deep; can be data, code, protocol (?)

description: if the format is proprietary and requires specific software to open/interpret, provide the software name and version
for tabular resource, schema of fields contained in tabular resource
notes: auto-infers the fields in a tabular data set; can also manually populate this property with either inline frictionless tabular resource schema OR with a path as a reference to a schema in another file
